subject: Sales
title: The Negative Close
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Negative Close usable.

hook.text: A seller says 'This probably isn't the right fit for everyone.' The buyer now wants to prove it is.

buildup.text: The negative close uses reverse psychology. Suggesting disqualification makes interest surge.

discovery.text: It activates competitive instinct. Being told you can't have something makes you want it more.

twist.text: Insurance agents perfected this: 'You may not qualify for our best rate.' Applicants try harder.

climax.text: Challenge the buyer gently with restraint. They'll close themselves just to prove you wrong.

punchline.text: Tell them they can't have it. They'll prove you wrong.

quiz.question: What psychological drive powers the negative close?
